update.description:
Several fixes we found while working on windows:

 * configure.bat is a helper script to compile sdformat without the need of system libraries
 * tinyxml headers need to be installed when building internal tinyxml
 * When build gazebo, MSVC is complaining about a duplicate symbol when no explicit destructor is defined.
 * Added INSTALL_WIN32.md with instructions about how to build it on Windows
update.title: Fixes to compile on Windows

content.raw: @gerkey FYI, closing this one, we can use default for sdformat.
content.html: @gerkey FYI, closing this one, we can use default for sdformat.

content.raw: ahh ok my lack of windows knowledge is showing
content.html: ahh ok my lack of windows knowledge is showing

content.raw: both calling forms work on windows, configure or configure.bat
content.html: both calling forms work on windows, configure or configure.bat

content.raw:
* [drone is happy](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/388)
* [jenkins homebrew is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/homebrew/job/sdformat-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/29/)

looks good to me
content.html:
• drone is happy
  • jenkins homebrew is happy

looks good to me

content.raw: Even if it is the same tarball that is in sourceforge, if we need this to work in our jenkins slaves at OSRF, it is useful to have it in packages.osrfoundation.org to avoid the restriction with the firewall.
content.html: Even if it is the same tarball that is in sourceforge, if we need this to work in our jenkins slaves at OSRF, it is useful to have it in packages.osrfoundation.org to avoid the restriction with the firewall.

content.raw:
There are some binaries at sourceforge:

http://sourceforge.net/projects/boost/files/boost-binaries/1.56.0/
content.html:
There are some binaries at sourceforge:

http://sourceforge.net/projects/boost/files/boost-binaries/1.56.0/
